title: Iran is unitary; Nigeria is federal

content.question: Iran and Nigeria differ in which of the following ways?

choices.label: Iran’s legal system is based on common law, but Nigeria’s is based on Shari’ah law.
Iran is a unitary state, but Nigeria is a federal state.
Nigeria relies on the exportation of oil to bolster its economy, but Iran does not.
Nigeria has regular elections, but Iran does not.
Nigeria allows women access to formal education, but Iran does not.

content.answer: Iran is a unitary state, but Nigeria is a federal state.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
